meanings.definition: The process of creating a temporary circuit prototype on a breadboard.
meanings.sent1: During breadboarding, engineers test different circuit designs.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy breadboarding to try out new electronic projects.
meanings.sent3: The breadboarding session turned into a fun competition among friends.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a breadboarding station, full of creative ideas waiting to be connected.
meanings.sent5: The art of breadboarding involves precision and creativity to bring circuits to life.

meanings.definition: The act of experimenting with electronic components on a breadboard.
meanings.sent1: Students learn about circuitry through hands-on breadboarding activities.
meanings.sent2: Breadboarding helps me understand how different components work together.
meanings.sent3: The breadboarding workshop sparked a newfound interest in electronics.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a breadboarding playground, exploring the endless possibilities of circuits.
meanings.sent5: The magic of breadboarding lies in the ability to transform ideas into functional circuits.

meanings.definition: A method of testing and designing circuits using a breadboard.
meanings.sent1: Engineers rely on breadboarding to troubleshoot circuit issues.
meanings.sent2: Breadboarding is an essential step in the circuit design process.
meanings.sent3: The breadboarding experiment led to a breakthrough in circuit optimization.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, breadboarding was like solving a puzzle with electronic pieces.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of breadboarding is in its simplicity yet powerful impact on circuit development.
